author: Anderson
comment: In the screenshots it shows multiple floating categories on the home screen, sounds cool, but in reality, it's not.  Whenever you open an app those categories are still going to be there.  Need to click something behind it?  You have to move it over.  Doesn't work as a launcher for the same reason.

reply.author: Geeks Empire
reply.content:
Thanks for Rating and Review
Please, first create 'Categories' then you will have list of them. Then click on each item of list to create 'Floating Categories' then you can have unlimited floating categories.
Also, you can contact me via Support@GeeksEmpire.net
Always Appreciate your Feedback
- GeeksEmpire

author: RUTHANN SMITH
comment: THE BEST ON-SCREEN SHORTCUT APP  definitely worth the Pro version. THIS IS EXACTLY WHAT I WAS LOOKING FOR!!  The application is very easy to setup and use, plus the icons are easily moved and deleted. The floating categories feature has been updated and is great!  The icons are much smaller you can add more than 3 shortcuts to free up more space on the screen. Because I use my tablet so much, I am constantly opening and closing apps.  It helps so much not to have to keep pressing that button and going to the pages or apps list. Another great feature is the RECOVER, it restores your shortcuts and categories as they were on the screen if the app was shut off.

reply.author: Geeks Empire
reply.content:
Thanks for Rating and Review
There will be huge update for Floating Categories feature. 
Also, you can contact me via Support@GeeksEmpire.net
Always Appreciate your Feedbacks
- GeeksEmpire

author: Kevin Gelking
comment: It's a nice idea but also very messy. The shortcuts stay on the screen even if you open another app which Can be nice, but is usually a hindrance. Of course you could probably automate it to hide shortcuts when you open certain apps, but it requires unnecessary setup that way.  Its a nice app if you have a lot of spare time to spend on settings and don't kind ugly spheres at the bottom of your screen :) (I'd prefer a more subtle bar over 7 bubbles)

reply.author: Geeks Empire
reply.content:
Thanks for Rating and Review
I get lots of feedbacks about adding more Setting too. This is why I should respect all ideas & test which idea has more fan... I am glad to read your feedbacks to enhance Graphical User Interface to have minimalist design & smooth user experience.
Please contact me: Support@GeeksEmpire.net
- GeeksEmpire
